channel.title: Comments on: Book Review: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Internals
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Moby
item.dc:creator: Moby
item.content:encoded:
Nice write up – I will seriously consider purchasing this book now – especially if its highly technical an in most cases probably over my head. I like a challenge ðŸ™‚

p.s. congrats on the job too ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Kimberly L. Tripp
item.dc:creator: Kimberly L. Tripp
item.content:encoded:
Oh, and remind me when we’re going to see you next… I’ll bring you a few more SQLskills pens (I have a sharpie problem too!! ðŸ˜‰

Cheers,
kt

item.title: By: Kimberly L. Tripp
item.dc:creator: Kimberly L. Tripp
item.content:encoded:
Hey there Jes – Nice review and well done reading the entire book since you won it only a few months ago… (it’s not like you didn’t have anything else to do, eh?).

Anyway, I just wanted to make sure that you knew that I put up a solution (.ssmssln) file with ALL of the samples from chapter 6. That’s really cool because I actually added a few more demos to the sample code (after the book was published).

Enjoy – and HAPPY NEW YEAR!!

http://www.sqlskills.com/BLOGS/KIMBERLY/post/Companion-content-for-Chapter-6-(Index-Internals)-of-SQL-Server-2008-Internals.aspx

Cheers,
kt

item.title: By: Luigi Zambetti
item.dc:creator: Luigi Zambetti
item.content:encoded:
Very good review, my compliments.
And, it’s true, this is a really difficult and detailed book!

Luigi

item.title: By: Michael D
item.dc:creator: Michael D
item.description: Nice review, i bought this last year and only managed to chapter 5 but Im gonna try again and hopefully get it finished before the 2012 version is out!
item.content:encoded: Nice review, i bought this last year and only managed to chapter 5 but Im gonna try again and hopefully get it finished before the 2012 version is out!

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I am looking forward to the 2012 version. I started with Inside SQL Server 7 written by Ron Soukup and Kalen Delaney, I have read every version since. I just wish they were still hardcover instead of the softcover version that they make now

I actually gave my 2005 copy to one of our lessthandot members two years ago since I purchased the book you are holding in your hands

item.title: By: Ken Jones
item.dc:creator: Ken Jones
item.description: Hi Trev, Kalen Delaney and her co-authors are currently working on the SQL Server 2012 edition, which should be available this summer.
item.content:encoded: Hi Trev, Kalen Delaney and her co-authors are currently working on the SQL Server 2012 edition, which should be available this summer.

item.title: By: Trev Swarm
item.dc:creator: Trev Swarm
item.description: Thanks for the review Jes. I've been looking forward to this since you mentioned it on twitter a bit ago. Do you know if there will be a similar book for SQL Server 2012, by chance?
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the review Jes. I’ve been looking forward to this since you mentioned it on twitter a bit ago. Do you know if there will be a similar book for SQL Server 2012, by chance?

item.title: By: John Halunen
item.dc:creator: John Halunen
item.description: Nice writeup Jes. Regarding understanding data pages it just gives us more options when dealing with corruption and other issues :)<br /> John
item.content:encoded:
Nice writeup Jes. Regarding understanding data pages it just gives us more options when dealing with corruption and other issues ðŸ™‚
